title.narrative: Georgia I2Q - Innovation, Inclusion and Quality

description.narrative: The project development objectives are to (i) expand access to preschool education and (ii) improve the quality of education and learning environments.

baseline.value: Baseline to be determined and set in 2020

title.narrative: New School Readiness Programs introduced and provided with equipment, furniture and technology
New architectural blueprints developed and 2 to 10 new model buildings accomodating preschools constructed
Establishment of Thematic Innovation Clubs in every region/municipality targeting gifted and other student interests and a system to ensure its sustainability
Select schools resourced with a school improvement package to strengthen the implementation of the whole school approach
Parents that report satisfaction with their engagement in the whole school improvement effort and demonstrate understanding of student-centered learning through beneficiary surveys in Year 1, 4 and 6
Number of new general education schools constructed
Percentage of girls participating in the Thematic Innovation clubs
Number of rehabilitated general education schools
Representative groups who report that the national consultation (and feedback) process on Georgia's Education policy principles wasresponsive to their views through an appropriate CE mechanism
Trainers and coaches of education workforce staff that receive training (ToT)
Beneficiary students with access to improved learning environments in project-supported schools
Female beneficiary students with access to improved learning environments in project-supported schools
5 to 6-year old children enrolled in School Readiness Programs (Pre-school level)
Development of a data integration strategy and action plan from PreK to HE

baseline.value: A data integration strategy action plan does not exist

target.value: A data integration strategy and action plan developed

actual.value: EMIS Diagnostic Assessment has been developed and is currently under review. This work will be carried out as part of the upcomingprocurement for capacity building of EMIS to be initiated in August 2022. The scope of work will include development of LMS and EMSincluding Early Childhood Information Software .

title.narrative: Learning outcomes of students in national formative assessments in project-supported general education schools

baseline.value: Baseline to be determined and set in 2020

title.narrative: Collaborative e-platform identified and strengthened to support audiovisuals, weblinks, lesson plans documents for teachers and education professionals

target.value: Collaborative e-platform identified, strengthened and used

actual.value: Terms of Reference for the design and development of Learning Management System (LMS) and Education Management System (EMS) isongoing as part of the ongoing diagnostic study of EMIS to be finalized in May 2022. Implementation period defined from August 2022to January 2024.

title.narrative: Multiyear communications strategy drafted and adopted based on general education policy principles

actual.value: The development of a multi-year communications strategy and an action plan in close collaboration with MESCS is ongoing by theselected company and will be finalized in May 2022.

title.narrative: New teacher training modules and manuals developed on modern child centred pedagogy and formative continuous assessment

actual.value: The diagnostic study and evaluation of trends in general education is well advanced. The contract was signed with MathematicaInc/USA in August 2021 and finalization is expected in June 2022. Work is in progress to finalize the Terms of Reference for hiringthe consulting company for the implementation of activities under this subcomponent. The company is expected to be hired by endApril 2022.

title.narrative: Diagnostic study completed and recommendations made for development and expansion of quality ECEC completed in Yr 1 and Yr 4

target.value: Diagnostic study completed and recommendations made

actual.value: The contract has been concluded on July 21, 2021 with the successful Consultant (JV PPMI Group, UAB (Leading Member) /Lithuania,International Step by Step Association (Member) / Netherlands and Ilia State University – Centre for Preschool and InclusiveEducation/Georgia (Member). Work is well advanced and finalization of the study is expected in June, 2022.

title.narrative: National formative assessment system introduced and established for primary and secondary grades

actual.value: No national assessments conducted; Initial draft of the national assessment policy framework will become available in April 2022.The team stressed the importance of accelerating this work and identifying approach, type of assessments (including subject choiceand grade), and cycle to be able to start preparations for the first set of national student assessments envisaged under theproject. Individual consultancy is being currently mobilized to support NAEC with the organization of server infrastructure fornational assessments to be conducted under the project.

title.narrative: Development of a data monitoring dashboard with quality monitoring indicators based on whole school approach

target.value: A data monitoring dashboard developed and operationalized

actual.value: EMIS Diagnostic Assessment has been developed and is currently under review. This work will be carried out as part of the upcomingprocurement for capacity building of EMIS to be initiated in August 2022. The scope of work will include development of LMS and EMSincluding Early Childhood Information Software .

title.narrative: System for preschool data reporting and consolidation mechanism established and incorporated in the EMIS

baseline.value: No systematic reporting and consolidation mechanisms exist

target.value: Systematic data reporting and consolidation mechanism established and streamlined in EMIS

actual.value: No systematic reporting and consolidation mechanisms exists. Diagnostic assessment of EMIS has been finalized, which includesconcrete recommendations and mechanisms for the design of ECD database and integration into the final Education Management System(EMS). The procurement process for capacity building of EMIS, including development of LMS and EMS with integrated Early ChildhoodInformation Software will be launched in August 2022.

title.narrative: Higher education grants established under Competitive Innovation Fund achieving at least 80 percent of their proposed objectives

target.value: Upto 45 grants awarded to foster modernization of teacher education programs and strengthen labor market linkages

actual.value: The Operational Manual for the Competitive Innovation Fund (CIF) has been developed and the pilot call for the first round ofprojects will be launched in Fall 2022. The launch of the main phase for the target 35 projects is planned in 2023-2024 (20projects are planned to be completed in 2023 and 15 in 2024).

title.narrative: Feasibility study conducted with recommendations for the establishment of National Institute of Educational Research completed

target.value: Feasibility study completed and recommendations made

title.narrative: Pre-service teacher education program accredited by EU in at least one university

target.value: Accreditation received in one university program

actual.value: Not undertaken Obtaining accreditation (granted by the foreign organization with the relevant competence recognized by theNCEQE) is the final progress of the pre-service teacher education program improvement measures envisaged by the project. Therelevant activities are planned for the period from May 2021 to December 2025.

title.narrative: School architectural standards reviewed and updated to be used in the construction and rehabilitation of schools

actual.value: The contract has been concluded with International Consulting company for the development of new school construction andrehabilitation standards. The development of General Education Infrastructure and Physical Environment Standards is well advanced in close collaboration with ESIDA, MDF, Early Childhood Development and General Education Departments of MES. The first draft ofthe new standards become available by April 2022 and will be finalized by June 2022. The remainder of time will be usedfor consultations with relevant Ministries and approval of the new standards by the client.

title.narrative: GIS education mapping system established and integrated educational tracking system in place

actual.value: Completed by the state funding; the system is operational.

title.narrative: Child-level ECEC quality monitoring instrument to strengthen support for school readiness and smooth transition to school introduced (based on MODEL/MELQO or other appropriate instrument)

baseline.value: No quality monitoring instrument in place

target.value: Quality monitoring instrument developed, tested and introduced

actual.value: No quality monitoring in place. Diagnostic study of ECD is well advanced and will be finalized in June 2022. The study will includerecommendations for the development and implementation of the new quality monitoring system for ECD. The selection of theinternational consulting company to implement activities under this subcomponent is ongoing and contract signing is expected in May2022.

title.narrative: Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning
Survey of change in female attitudes towards STEAM conducted amongst girls participating in the Thematic Innovation clubs

actual.value: Survey will take place in November 2023.

title.narrative: Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning - Female
